description: From huck (from Middle English hoke (“hook”), hokebone, probably so called because of its round shape) + -le. See also hook.

examples: […]  which approves a quick gathering up of his legs withoute pain, his huckle bones round and hidden,  […]

entries.meaning: A bunch or part projecting like the hip.

examples: He’s not! He can’t be! There's never been a huckle in the Osbourne family, and we can trace our lineage all the way back to the Second World War.
